title: Retro font (Killing me!! AAAAAHHH!!!!)
content:
hey guys. I CANNOT find this font anywhere. sigh. please help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [dancers-dos.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413154825/http:/typophile.com/files/dancers-dos.jpg) | 94.7 KB |
author: Dubtron9000

comments.content: Which one -- the top or the bottom one? The bottom one is Monotype Script Bold; the top one I know but can't remember the name (rats!).
Harlow! Good one, Rainer. Reliable as ever. More than my memory anyway. :^)
you guys are amazing...thank you SO much. I love this forum
You are welcome, Ryan. And thanks for the flowers, oh Big Yves! ;^D

Well, but isn't the correct source font this one?

Prägefest  
Ludwig & Mayer, Frankfurt am Main  
Erstguß 1926  
Eduard Lautenbach

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413154825im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_6564.jpg)

Georg  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
„Ich bin ein Preuße, kennt Ihr meine Farben...“

Yes and no, Georg. According to my notes, Script Bold was Monotype's 1931, ahem ..., "version" of Lautenbach's earlier Prägefest. There are lots of little details that differ, though. Look at the construction of the 'n' and crossbar of the 't' for two examples.

… and the uppercase A, M, N (etc) for the most obvious. ;^D

I think Jürgen Siebert wrote something like »You can't protect the letterforms, only the name and the digitization« (Hope I remembered correct)

Well, of course its different. But I thought Praegefest was first and Monotype 1931 changed some minor details, so they did not hurt any copyrights. Am I to open to tell, how it is? Or am I wrong? However...

I'ld say the source font was Praegefest.  
Mh? Yes, right: I don't like Monotype lead fonts too much.  
But its only my personal opinion.

Georg  
By the way:  
How do you guys like my new Avatar?  
Its from A. Paul Weber.  
I got the idea looking the News in TV about the crash yesterday. I hopy you guys will survive it.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
„Ich bin ein Preuße, kennt Ihr meine Farben...“
